thag10.6:1.1_0: In order to go on retreat,
thag10.6:1.2_0: a monk should stay in lodgings
thag10.6:10.1_0: For a mendicant who meditates in this way,
thag10.6:2.1_0: Having gathered scraps from rubbish heaps,
thag10.6:2.3_0: and making an outer robe from them,
thag10.6:2.4_0: one should wear that coarse robe.
thag10.6:3.2_0: a mendicant should walk for alms
thag10.6:4.1_0: They should be content even with coarse food,
thag10.6:4.2_0: not hoping for lots of flavors.
thag10.6:4.3_0: The mind that’s greedy for flavors
thag10.6:6.3_0: an astute person would not speak overly long
thag10.6:6.4_0: in the midst of the Saṅgha.
thag10.6:8.1_0: Expert in the arising of thought,
thag10.6:8.2_0: they would grasp well the pattern of the mind.
thag10.6:8.3_0: They would be devoted to practicing
thag10.6:8.4_0: serenity and discernment at the right time.
thag10.6:9.1_0: Though endowed with energy and perseverance,
thag10.6:9.3_0: a wise person would not be too sure of themselves,
thag10.6:9.4_0: until they have attained the end of suffering.
